did.abstract: Records of the League of Women Voters Grosse Pointe, Mich. chapter includes administrative, annual meetings and issues materials, and publications.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: Material was donated by the League of Women Voters of Grosse Pointe (Donor no. 10902) in March 2013

accruals.p: No further additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, League of Women Voters of Grosse Pointe records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The League of Women Voters is a nonpartisan political organization encouraging the informed and active participation of citizens in government. It influences public policy through education and advocacy and not support or oppose any particular political party or candidate. The Grosse Pointe, Mich. chapter of the League of Women Voters was founded in 1950. Through the years the Grosse Pointe chapter has been involved in a number of social, civil, and environmental causes, such as juvenile delinquency, exceptional children (emotionally challenged children), voter education, voter services and rights, local government, libraries, parks, among others.

scopecontent.p: The administrative records of the League of Women Voters Grosse Pointe encompass material of the chapter's Board and include dated from the early 1950s to 2009. Also found here are versions and editions of by-laws, as well as awards and citations received by the chapter between the 1950s and 2009. Material of the chapter's annual meeting, called by the chapter "Local annual meeting," include meeting minutes between 1953 and 2009. Membership material, dated between 1950 and 2009, includes rosters and member directories. Chapter's many activities are reflected in the newsletter The Grosse Pointe Voter, or The Voter, and in a collection of material dedicated to specific issues. The collection includes issues of The Voter dated between 1958 and 2009. Also included is the chapter's annually published listing of Grosse Pointe's public and government officials, dated from 1960 to 2009.
